result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Michael J. Ruch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall comply with all of the terms of bond, which continues to remain in effect during the period of this agreement.  Defendant must successfully complete he two year probationary period and all required conditions of probation.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss the charge.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.  Defendatn shall have a sex offender assessment.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than August 18, 2018 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement
Second Amended Information

Defendant Michael J. Ruch in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Victim is on the phone.  State filed an Amended Information.  Plea of no contest to all three counts in the amended information.    Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Argument by counsel. Statement by Michael Ruch.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 and 3.  Court makes a finding of guilt on Count 1.   Court defers entry of judgment for a period of two years.  Court orders on count 1 standard conditions and successfully complete probation in counts 2 and 3.  Upon successful completion of the deferred agreement the charge will be dismissed.   Counts 2 and 3 court orders withheld sentence placement on probation for two years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and DNA surcharge (surcharge on count 2 only); counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; 5 months county jail on each count concurrent to each other to begin no later than August 18, 2018 at 4:30 pm; comply with the sex offender registry;  sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations; may petition the court for reconsideration of the sex offender registry after the sex offender assessment.  No sentence credit. - rt
